column2: A traveller from the east reaches your court along with his personal bodyguard. Reading from a scroll, he states that the Great Emperor of China demands a tribute of a thousand 'heavenly horses' from your lands.

Another envoy from China arrives at your court. He tells you that he himself is a gift - a token of gratitude from the Emperor - and that he is an excellent governor of trade if you need his services.
I've noticed an increase in traders coming from the east since I employed [chinese_envoy.GetBestName] as a trade governor.
[chinese_envoy.GetBestName] has managed to acquire a collection of rare gemstones on your behalf.
A couple of travelling merchants claim that their goods were stolen while they stayed on your premises.

Enthusiastic and blabbering [chinese_envoy.GetFirstName] pulls a large sack into the room. [chinese_envoy.GetSheHeCap] apparently found valuable goods laying on the premises and wants to share it with you.
I hear a scream outside and rush out only to see [chinese_envoy.GetFirstName]'s snake swallowing the dog of [dog_owner.GetFirstName] in a single gulp.
I hear a dog barking outside and rush out only to see [chinese_envoy.GetFirstName]'s dastardly snake swallowing my beloved dog in a single gulp.

You are out taking a walk together with [marriage_target.GetFirstName] when [chinese_envoy.GetFirstName] approaches you with a concern. According to Chinese law [chinese_envoy.GetSheHe] is required to get a woman to continue his services more permanently.

Dust rise in your wake as you head for the local tavern with heavy steps. As you enter, you instantly notice [chinese_envoy.GetFirstName], seemingly involved in a game of chance. You approach [chinese_envoy.GetHerHim] and realize that [chinese_envoy.GetSheHe] is betting your money on games of chance... and losing. [chinese_envoy.GetFirstName] looks up at you with a smile and says: 'Hey. Your drinksch are taschty'.

[chinese_envoy.GetBestName] entered my chamber with [chinese_envoy.GetHerHis] newly acquired pet snake wrapped around [chinese_envoy.GetHerHis] neck. [chinese_envoy.GetSheHeCap] asks if I want to pet it.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName],

I hereby inform you that I'm leaving the position at your court because of the less than preferable way that you have treated me.

Signed
[chinese_envoy.GetFirstName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]

Your insolence has not gone unnoticed. I will henceforth punish all travellers who are suspected of having have visited your city. 

Signed,
The Emperor.
Reports have reached us that traders and travellers are being harassed by raiders in your lands of [Root.GetName].
A group of raiders are threatening the trade in our realm. My liege, [Liege.GetTitledFirstName], has ordered me to go after their leader, and make sure that the roads are safe for caravans.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] brought forth to me the head of the raiders' leader, of the bandit leader whom previously plagued merchants in [FromFrom.GetName].
In the late afternoon [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s horse arrived home riderless. There's no telling what the raiders have done to [From.GetHerHim].

The coward [From.GetTitledFirstName] deemed it too dangerous to interfere with the caravan raiders, and refused to carry out my orders. I could have [From.GetHerHim] arrested for this, however, that would not solve the problem of merchants being attacked on my trade routes.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] arrives bruised and alone from his venture to drive away the raiders. Unfortunately he brings the news that he has been unable to fight off the raiders from our land.
After the sunset I manage to track down the raiders encampment. Me and my men decide to...

As we enter the camp, we pass clusters of tents and campfires. While I can only see a small group of raiders, I can feel many eyes upon me. Approaching the center of the settlement, a silhouette - who I assume is the leader of the raiders - exits a large tent, and greets me with a smirk.

While engaged in a fairly one-sided conversation about property and rights, I fail to notice the thug sneaking up behind me. I just barely notice their leader making a subtle nodding motion before a sharp blow to the back of my head robs me of consciousness.

I'm brought to consciousness by the sound of laughter and shouts. As my eyes adjust to the unforgiving sunlight, I realize that I have been tied up. The raiders have dressed me in silly clothes and are parading me around town, demanding a pile of gold in return for my freedom.

As we are closing in on the raiders' camp we count on the cover of darkness to keep us from sight. This turns out to be a foolish mistake, as we abruply find ourselves both surrounded and outnumbered.

After subduing the guards on watch we enter the leader's tent. While he's fast asleep I draw my blade, placing it with great precision against his throat. Suddenly his eyes flicker open, and his gaze wanders the tent with a dazed urgency. I realize that if I do not act quickly, he may very well draw attention to us.
These are the finest and strongest horses.
I'll let him govern the trade.
Let the silk flow.
Sell them for profit.
Apologize and reimburse them.
I wonder if this is just a coincidence?
Ahem.. We were just discussing that matter, [marriage_target.GetFirstName]. Right?
Just stay away from these people.
I hope it doesn't bite.
That's too bad.
This could be bad for trade.
I'll let them continue if they share the loot.
It is my duty.
Excellent work!
What a horrible fate.
I need to deal with my unruly marshal.
Annoying pests!
... enter the camp and approach their leader.
Fight the leader to shatter the band of raiders.
Ow!
Pay them for my freedom.
Surrender.
Threaten him to leave my land!
Your Emperor has no power here!
He can muck the stables.
These will fit great in a pendant.
That's their loss.
Find the merchants and return their lost cargo.
I guess I have no more need of your services then.
Arrest this [chinese_envoy.GetManWoman].
It seems a bit dangerous.
Send my marshal to hunt them down.
I won't risk my life against the dangerous bandits.
I need to deal with these rascals personally.
I have to root out the raiders myself.
... wait until midnight and sneak up on the guards.
Bribe the raiders to leave my land.
Plead for mercy.
Let's dance!
Slit his throat and fight our way out.
Politely decline the offer.
I'll make some earrings for my [Root.Spouse.GetHusbandWife].
Forbid [chinese_envoy.GetHerHim] from keeping the snake.
Ready my horse. I'll get rid of the scoundrel.
Get the soldiers to chase them out.
Organize soldiers to take care of the raiders.
Diplomatically explain why they can't harass travellers.
Refusing orders while give my liege a reason to arrest me.
That's the way of life.
Someone slay that beast before it does more harm!
Poor [Root.GetDogName]!
I'll have [FromFrom.GetHerHis] head for this!
Poor Ahriman!
Poor Darkness!
Poor Erlik!
Poor Faithful!
Poor Fenrir!
Poor Guruhi!
Poor Hunter!
Poor Lucifer!
Poor Mara!
Poor Punisher!
Poor Satan!
Poor Shaytan!
Poor Tricky!
Poor Tuoni!
Poor Veles!
Poor Velnias!
Poor Vinayaka!
Poor Xolotl!
